description: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for a deadly blast at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, which resulted in over three dozen casualties. The terror outfit's mouthpiece stated the attack was a Fidayeen operation by a soldier of the Islamic State in Pakistan Province. This claim comes amidst growing sectarian tensions and an IS call for Lashkar-e-Taiba members to defect.

description: A police inspector died and 13 were injured when an electrical swing collapsed at the Surajkund International Crafts Fair. The ride, carrying 26 people, came unhinged mid-operation. A stall owner rescued several riders before the swing fully collapsed, trapping the inspector. Investigations into mechanical or electrical failure are underway.

title: ‘Kerala always felt like home’: Britain-born Pepita Seth is now an Indian citizen

Delhi biker death case: Contractor who’d dug pit came, saw and left as victim lay there for hours
description: A 25-year-old biker died after falling into a 14-foot pit in Janakpuri. The sub-contractor who dug the pit was arrested after he allegedly saw the victim and left without calling for help. The pit was dug just hours before the accident, with no warning signs or barricades.

'Should've sent Pak home': Netherlands left distraught after defeat in tense match
description: The Netherlands felt they lost their T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan due to poor execution in the final overs, not Pakistan outplaying them. A dropped catch and missed opportunities allowed Faheem Ashraf to change the game, securing a Pakistan victory. Despite the disappointment, the team remains proud of their fight and looks to their next match.

title: Suryakumar scripts history, triggers Netravalkar's worst-ever T20I WC spell
description: India's T20 World Cup opener saw a dramatic turnaround, with Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 off 49 balls rescuing the team from a precarious 77 for 6. His captain's knock, the second-highest debut score in T20 World Cup history, guided India to a competitive total despite a costly spell from Saurabh Netravalkar.

title: ‘His bravery saved many lives’: Cop who died amid Surajkund fair swing collapse rescue op would have retired in March

description: A single-Judge Bench mandated the student to stand at the campus gate for 30 days carrying a placard declaring, “I will never misbehave with any girl”

title: Mysterious gas leak causes panic in Jammu; probe launched to identify nature of substance
description: Several residents of Rani Bagh complained of breathlessness following the sudden leakage of gas from an abandoned cylinder lying at the scrap dealer’s premises, say officials

title: Trade deal: US whiskey, wine unlikely to give headache to Indian companies
description: Duty concessions on American whiskey and wine are unlikely to significantly impact Indian companies due to minimum import prices and low existing volumes. American whiskey holds less than 0.1% of the Indian market, with distinct flavors appealing to a niche segment. Similarly, imported wines face distribution challenges, with Australian wines leading the small segment.

title: Dramatic turnaround: From brink of collapse, PM Modi & Trump deliver a deal
description: India and the US have reached a breakthrough interim trade agreement, a significant shift from recent tensions. This deal, a precursor to a larger pact, offers advantages to India's MSME and labor-intensive sectors. Negotiators successfully resisted pressure on sensitive agricultural imports, a move likely to please the US president's base ahead of mid-term polls.

title: The $500 billion question: What will India import from US?
description: India aims to import $500 billion in US goods over five years, but success hinges on American suppliers meeting demand.  While oil and coal imports are set to rise, high-tech items like chips and aircraft face supply chain challenges.  Indian buyers and US sellers must collaborate to achieve this ambitious trade target.

title: Forgetting Hindu sentiments led to Partition: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
description: “We said we respect all religions because we are Hindus. There are people who say this was wrong. Islam and Christianity still exist in India. There are skirmishes, but the country has remained united,” says Bhagwat

title: ‘Unblock our lives’ | Women gig workers protest in Delhi
description: The women partners of service provider Urban Company are protesting against the lack of flexibility, a promise that initially pulled them in. They speak about being stuck in a loop of algorithmic exploitation and constant surveillance

title: Israel says Netanyahu will meet with Trump about Iran talks on February 11
description: The U.S. and the Islamic Republic of Iran held indirect talks on February 6 in Oman that appeared to return to the starting point on how to approach discussions over Tehran’s nuclear programme

title: 'Psychological issues, was in debt’: Ex-owner of Multani Bakery jumps from 17th floor, dies
description: Former owner of Solapur's renowned Multani Bakery, Sunil Motilal Sadarangani, died by suicide by jumping from a 17th-floor apartment building. Police suspect psychological issues and debt contributed to his actions. Sadarangani had sold his bakery and relocated to Pune, with his family confirming his struggles.

title: Days after 32-hour ordeal, Mumbai-Pune Expressway clogged yet again
description: Mumbai-Pune expressway faced another weekend traffic nightmare with heavy vehicles causing significant delays. This follows a recent 32-hour snarl from a tanker accident. Officials cite election-related travel and the resumption of stalled truck movement for the persistent gridlock, turning peak hours into a frustrating crawl for thousands.

title: Trust has become India's strongest currency: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Modi highlighted recent trade agreements with the US and other nations as proof of growing global trust in India. He emphasized the country's shift from a mere market to an investment and trade hub, fostering 'Make in India' and creating jobs. These deals, he stated, reflect a dynamic partnership and commitment to innovation and shared prosperity.

title: 'Politically motivated': Sonia Gandhi slams plea over 1980 voter list inclusion
description: Sonia Gandhi Saturday termed a criminal revision petition against a magisterial order as "politically motivated and frivolous." The petition alleges her name was included in electoral rolls in 1980 using forged documents, despite her acquiring Indian citizenship later. Gandhi argued citizenship and electoral roll issues fall outside criminal court jurisdiction.

title: Interests of Indian farmers ‘completely protected’ in Indo-U.S. trade deal: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
description: The reduced 18% tariffs will help Indian basmati rice find more market in the world, says Minister

title: Trust has become India’s strongest currency: PM Modi in Malaysia
Bengal CM stole limelight, despite me being original petitioner: CPI(M)’s Mostari Banu
description: Mostari Banu, who hails from Bhagwangola in Murshidabad and is associated with the CPI(M), said it was in response to her petition that the Supreme Court issued directions on January 19 to the ECI

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
description: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
description: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

This significant procurement, with a substantial portion to be manufactured in India, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's fighter squadron strength amidst rising regional security concerns.

Over the last few years, Kayla Nicole has also been brutally trolled for allegedly making subtle digs at Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's high profile relationship.

title: Mavericks vs Spurs injury report: Playing status, head-to-head, stats & more

The Spurs have won both previous meetings this season. Player availability will be crucial in this matchup. This game offers Dallas a chance to gauge progress against a top Western Conference team.

Bachchan asserted that India is no longer a third-world nation but a first-world one, evidenced by its numerous world championships.

title: MLB trade rumours: Reds tipped to land $10.2m Yankees slugger to boost title odds
description: Cincinnati Reds are eyeing Jazz Chisholm Jr. to bolster their lineup, potentially trading pitcher Brady Singer and infielder Matt McLain. Chisholm offers proven power and speed, addressing the Reds' offensive struggles. The Yankees, seeking pitching depth and infield versatility, might consider the deal to manage future payroll. This move could boost Cincinnati's playoff hopes.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
description: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: With a banjo on my wall
description: On February 8, 1802, horologist Simon Willard received a patent for what is popularly known as a banjo clock. A clockmaker of repute in the U.S., Willard worked his hands on the hands of many a clock. A.S.Ganesh tells you what made him and his clocks tick…
